title: The best Yule logs of 2023 to test across France
description: From classic chocolate and hazelnuts to exotic mango and lime, kirsch or speculoos, these 15 desserts provide a variety of tastes (and colors) to satisfy your cravings!

title: Mohamed Bazoum, the unyielding captive of Niger's junta
description: The head of state, overthrown by a putsch in July, refuses to resign. He has been detained in Niamey for over four months, along with his wife and their son.

title: Why is Ukraine's counteroffensive failing?
description: In an interview with The Economist, Valeriy Zaluzhny, the commander-in-chief of Ukraine's army, claims that his country has reached a 'stalemate.'

title: Javier Milei warns economy will 'worsen' in Argentina
description: On Sunday morning, Milei was sworn in inside the National Congress building, and outgoing President Alberto Fernández placed the presidential sash upon him.

title: Besieged once again, Gaza's health system is in agony
description: Once again bombarded since the end of the truce on December 1, hospitals are unable to accommodate the thousands of Gazans in need of emergency care.

title: The trauma of Israeli Arab women freed in exchanges with Hamas
description: 15 women, arrested after the October 7 attacks for expressing themselves on social media, have been exchanged for hostages held by Hamas, without having asked to be. This association with the Islamist movement could harm them in Israel.

title: Netflix's black Hannibal sparks controversy in Tunisia
description: The choice of African-American actor Denzel Washington to portray the famous Carthaginian general has set social media abuzz, and is now being debated in Parliament.

title: Hong Kong holds first council elections under drastic new rules that shut out pro-democracy candidates
description: Residents went to the polls on Sunday in the first district council elections since an electoral overhaul was implemented under Beijing's guidance of 'patriots' administering the city.

title: Le Monde's top 10 destinations | #8 Tapas in Zaragoza
description: Where to travel in 2024? This year, Le Monde answers that question with 10 travel picks accessible by train from France. Discover two travel guides per week throughout December. Number 8: Zaragoza.

title: COP28: Fossil fuel taxation at the heart of the battle to finance climate transition
description: In preparation for COP30 in 2025, an international taskforce launched in June is to work on ways of getting the biggest greenhouse gas emitters to contribute.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'Anti-poor ideology ultimately leads to a general deterioration in the quality of public service'
description: Taking it out on the poorest will not solve social problems, argues the economist in his column, after a Le Monde investigation into the algorithm used by France's welfare agency to decide which households to audit for benefit fraud.

title: COP28 pledges meet only 30% of needed energy emission cuts, says IEA
description: 'While the pledges are positive steps forward in tackling the energy sector's greenhouse gas emissions, they would not be nearly enough to move the world onto a path to reaching international climate targets,' the IEA said in its report.

title: Zelensky, Bolsonaro to attend Javier Milei's inauguration ceremony in Argentina
description: After taking the oath of office, Milei will give his first speech as president and swear in a cabinet of nine ministers.

title: Paris 2024: IOC allowed Russians to take part in the Olympics. What happens now?
description: How many Russian and Belarussian athletes will take part in the Olympics and how will their neutrality be ensured? While the IOC's decision comes as no surprise, it creates a series of questions.

title: China and Philippines trade blame for collision in disputed waters
description: Both vessels suffered damage in the incident, which took place in the South China Sea.

title: The United Arab Emirates' takeover of African forests
description: As the oil-rich country hosts COP28, an Emirati company has signed agreements in Liberia, Tanzania, Zambia and Zimbabwe to convert part of their land into carbon credits – acts of 'greenwashing' and 'colonialism,' some NGOs say.

title: 14 killed in central Mexico in clash between criminal gang and villagers
description: Authorities say 10 of the dead are gang members. The violent Familia Michoacana drug cartel has been dominant in the area for many years.

title: Guyanese and Venezuelan leaders to meet Thursday on border row
description: Venezuela has launched maneuvers to take over a part of Guyana after a controversial referendum was held last week.

title: Nobel winner Mohammadi to go on new hunger strike as peace prize is awarded
description: Her husband says the strike is in solidarity with the Baha'i religious minority, which is the target of discrimination in Iran.

title: Egypt's upcoming election is tailor-made for Marshal Al-Sissi
description: The incumbent president is expected to continue his reign for a third six-year term following the December 12 vote. The only unknown factor is turnout, with Egyptians making no secret of their disinterest in the vote.

title: Geert Wilders and his disruptive haircut won the Dutch election. Does anyone care?
description: The far-right scored a surprise victory in the Dutch parliamentary elections on November 22. A perfect opportunity to get to know its triumphant leader, Geert Wilders, once again.

title: UPenn president resigns after anti-Semitism testimony backlash
description: Elizabeth Magill 'voluntarily tendered her resignation' after scathing criticism against her and other university leaders.
